intro: Trixis havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban trixis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, often blooming in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
